intro: Cyphostigma latiflorum, commonly known as the broadflower cyphostigma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. Its leaves are typically ovate and arranged oppositely along the stems. Cyphostigma latiflorum is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade.
